---
title: "competitions"
---

Having logged in using the [`betfair`](betfair.html) function, the environment contains the `competitions` method.  Which can be used to get competitions (eg. World Cup 2014) associated with various markets.

### usage

```{r eval=FALSE}
bf$competitions(filter = marketFilter())
```

### arguments

param | details
------|---------
`filter` | select desired markets, see [marketFilter](marketFilter.html) for various parameters to filter by, or the relevant [help pages](https://api.developer.betfair.com/services/webapps/docs/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Betting+Type+Definitions#BettingTypeDefinitions-MarketFilter) on Betfair.  If nothing is entered, **all** competitions are returned

### return

The function returns a dataframe of competitions associated with the markets selected by the `filter` parameter, the dataframe contains the following:

variable | details
---------|--------
`competition_id` | competition id
`competition_name` | competition name
`marketCount` | number of markets associated with the competition
`competitionRegion` | region in which this competition is happening

### examples

```
# login
bf <- betfair(usr = Sys.getenv("BETFAIR_USR"), pwd = Sys.getenv("BETFAIR_PWD"), key = Sys.getenv("BETFAIR_KEY"))

# return all competitions
bf$competitions()

# return all football competitions
bf$competitions(filter = marketFilter(eventTypeIds = 1))

```
